Posts.Content: Hi Mags, Thanks for replying and sharing your experience! Can't believe how many women are suffering from the same side effects! I do a half hour walk with my dogs...was doing it daily but just haven't felt able lately so my partner has been taking them on her own... I have written down the Naproxen so will ask my GP. Think I will also have a word with oncologist in a fortnight. They must be able to advise on something to help with the side effects! Thanks again.  Lynn Feeling more hopeful!
Posts.Title: Side effects of aromatase inhibitors

Posts.Content: Thanks so much Helen. It all helps xx
Posts.Title: Side effects of aromatase inhibitors

Posts.Content: Thanks Mandy...the support and advice you are all giving has helped so much! I don't think I am soft and feel I have quite a high pain threshold but the side effects of this medication has got me down. Glad of the 2 week holiday!
Posts.Title: Side effects of aromatase inhibitors

Posts.Content: Hi all. I have just joined the group and hoping for some advice. Was diagnosed with breast cancer 2 years ago. It was quite low grade. I had a lumpectomy followed by 4 weeks of radiotherapy. I was then put on Letrozole. After about 6 months I found the side effects too difficult to cope with... really bad aching joints... unable to sleep... just felt pain throughout my body and no energy. I was then put on Anatrozole...same problem for a year... now on Exemestane and unfortunately it is no better  I have been diagnosed with Osteopenia and Osteoarthritis but the pain from these tablets makes it so much worse. The oncologist has agreed for me to have a 2 week "holiday" Don't know what will happen but I am hoping pain will ease. I have been told it wouldn't be wise to stop altogether. It is getting me down because I am used to being active. Sorry for the long text x
Posts.Title: Side effects of aromatase inhibitors

Posts.Content: HI Kargus! This website is great for support! So good to know we are not alone...and ladies are sharing experience and ideas on what works for them! Maybe it's a new version of # Me too! Not making light of the original one!
Posts.Title: Side effects of aromatase inhibitors

Posts.Content: Thanks Mazza 10 for sharing your experience. I have done some research and had long chats with the oncologist and they seem to be very against stopping the  drugs. His words were " oestrogen is like oxygen for your breast cancer cells. If you don't take the oestrogen inhibitors the cells are fuelled by oestrogen" I understand that...but as you say I need some quality of life now...xx
Posts.Title: Side effects of aromatase inhibitors

Posts.Content: Thanks so much Warm Auburn for your reply...and lots of practical advice! I have been taking paracetamol at night but it doesn't do anything... Yes I will definitely ask for some anti inflammatory tablets. Just need to stop trying to do everything I am used to doing and getting frustrated when I can't. A friend said I might have fibromyalgia yesterday  Not sure what that is but I feel sure it's a side effect of the tablets. Feel like I'm moaning all the time xx
